website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty ratchet straps that are easy to use and won't let you down, even on the toughest jobs.
pros: Coated handle and S-hooks for ultimate comfort and no scratching
Rugged, durable straps won't stretch or break
cons: Some have said that the coating on the hooks flakes off over time

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use once you know how / Quality tie downs
customer_reviews.text: Arrived neatly packaged with a cool little storage bag. Instruction card is included which as a first time ratchet strap user I was glad too see, however I found it not helpful. Rhino’s instructional video was a little more helpful but not much. Watched another instructional video with much more detailed instruction on how to use ratchet straps. After that I have had no problems using these straps. Easy to thread, tighten, and loosen. Would definitely recommend if your looking for quality tie downs. Just redo the video to make it clearer for first time users.
customer_reviews.author: runCMB

customer_reviews.title: Ratchet straps!  They're great.
customer_reviews.text: Oh, ratchet straps - however did I live without you in my life? Seriously these things are great. I had to look up a Youtube video on how to use them, but once you get the hang of it they're super easy to use and extremely secure. I used these to tie down a roof bag for a trip and they were just great. I carry them around in the trunk of my car and I am sure they'll get a lot of use. The straps themselves are very substantial and strong, and the hardware is simple to use but well made, I had no worries about them coming loose even when hanging off of them to test them.
customer_reviews.author: jeninmaine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. These ratchet straps are just what I needed for my kayak. They are high quality, sturdy, well made straps and made in the USA. If your looking for good straps for your boat, motorcycle or anything that needs to be securely tied down go with Rhino.
customer_reviews.author: MelodyO

customer_reviews.title: First of all I was pretty impressed by the packaging when the Rhino Straps arrived
customer_reviews.text: First of all I was pretty impressed by the packaging when the Rhino Straps arrived. they come in a pretty cool little black sack with the rhino logo printed on the front,easy to grab and go. The straps are simple to use, and trust me, some are not. I was able to strap down some furniture on my friends truck during my move over the weekend, i was pretty happy to have my own set of straps for the very first time! Easy to use, great design and get the job done... what more can you ask for? Ashley CM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap Started to Tear During 1st Use
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I used one of these straps for the first time to secure lightweight furniture into the bed of my truck and driving 20 minutes down the road, not driving faster than 40mph. When I got to where I was going I noticed the strap had begun to tear and come apart. I have different straps, that are supposedly "weaker", that I've used, hauling much heavier things, travelling at highway speeds that have never come apart. I was excited to get these new straps in because I only have 10ft straps and the extra 5ft is great. I was very let down by this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: This could have been bad becasue it was securing a Polaris 500cc ATV in ...
customer_reviews.text: These have a lifetime warranty - but I realized when I returned home from a recent camping trip that one of the ratchet tie downs broke on the way home. This could have been bad becasue it was securing a Polaris 500cc ATV in the toy hauler. Glad there was another tie down and all the brakes were set. I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a negative star rating, I would. These ratchet straps are absolute junk. I've used ratchet straps all my life and never had garbage like these. The release on 3 of the straps fell apart and 2 of the straps popped with very little load on them. So out of the 4 total straps, I have one left that I'm waiting on to fail. Please do yourself a favor and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: E. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, completely unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really surprised these straps get such good reviews. They are made of an extremely thin fabric. You can tell when you tighten them down, you can tap them with your finger and they sound like a guitar string. I used 4 straps on an atv for the first trip and one strap broke clean. I contacted them and they sent me a new complete set, which was great, but just as cheaply made. Two uses later, another strap snapped. So of the 8 straps I now only had 6, and I don’t trust them to strap down anything. I would never buy anything from Rhino again. I appreciate the great customer service, but the products are very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Ruppert

customer_reviews.title: One time use straps. Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Had all four straps break on first use. Went out to go four wheeling and used these to strap ATVs down. By the time I had gotten to my destination, 2 straps had broken and by the time I got home the other two were about to give out. These probably work great for strapping a cooler but they are not as tough as they seem. Pretty much paid the money for a cook rhino sticker. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special.  Not American made.  Junk to average at best
customer_reviews.text: They arent that great. Very sloppy and poor tolerances. Feel cheap!! The Goodyear and Snap-on brand straps I buy at Costco are better made and less money. This is a marketing hype!! Rhino USA... THESE ARE NOT MADE IN THE USA!! THEY ARE CHEAP CHINESE STRAPS. Maybe, MAYBE, a step above Harbor Freight junk. Super disappointed. But not worth my time or effort to return. I will get what use I can from them, then toss in trash. I will buy a back up set next time i am at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Lee Soon

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, worked great, But missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I finally had a chance to open and use the straps, the straps look and work easily. *But I was missing the 4 soft loops to go around the handle bars of my bicycles. I wish I would of opened them when I received them so I could of contacted the company, I just checked and to buy them separately they are $12.97. Lesson learned, always open everything as soon as you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.... unbelievably cheap
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE... after these horrible straps failed to stay tight I only used them on light items and 2 have now broken completely. Worst item I ever bought on Amazon and I buy a lot. Obviously they are stacking the comments.... Old review... I researched many straps and have owned many for many purposes. I purchased these due to the claim of strength and dependability as well as the positive reviews. I am using 4 at a time in an enclosed trailer and everytime I check they are very loose. Even after short distances the straps need to be tightened again. Guess I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Knutson

customer_reviews.title: Should be called RHINO CHINA Ratchet Straps
customer_reviews.text: While they don't come straight out and say "These ratchet straps are made in the USA", it is insinuated by the language on the page that these are made in the USA. I paid a higher price for these than other Made in China straps, to support the economy of the USA. I have no problem buying products that are made outside of the USA, but I do have a problem with deceptive advertising. These do seem like well-made straps, and I do not want a refund. I just want people to know that these are not made in the USA prior to buying.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: One broke
customer_reviews.text: Used four all last summer on a trailer to tie down a Kabota 2360 sub compact tractor. I had one break for seemingly no reason about 4 inches above a hook. There was no obstructions. Certainly this tractor was with-in the 1,823 lb break strength. I have since gone to another make and a high break strength. I am very impressed with RHINO as a USA company and the quality product they put out. I have had great success with their tow rope. I will buy more products in the future but will not continue to use this one for this specific application.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Broke within an hour
customer_reviews.text: I brought two of my quads down to Tennessee from Michigan and used these ratchet straps to hold the quads down on the trailer. We didn't even make it out of Michigan and two of them broke. They are junk. Luckily I had an extra set in the quads in case I needed a tow strap or something. I used those instead and they lasted the whole trip. The extra set was just a cheap set I bought from walmart and they worked way better than these did. If you value whatever you are loading, I encourage you to find a different set to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look great but tore on first use
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with these ratchet straps when they arrived since they look great and come with a carrying bag and velcro strips so you can keep them tidy. However, on my very first use the strap that I used tore. I lost one hook on the road and dragged the other behind me for a while before I noticed and stopped (you can see it this in the picture).
customer_reviews.author: Ylem

customer_reviews.title: Does not match product picture.
customer_reviews.text: Specifically bought these for the retainers/keepers on the cargo hooks, as shown in the product pictures. When the kit arrived they had standard ratchet strap hooks (open) like anything I could have bought at the local hardware store. I noticed that various pictures in their product listing show both. Its a decent product for the price, but they need to fix the picture or the product so that they match.
customer_reviews.author: jordan s moore

customer_reviews.title: no thanks
customer_reviews.text: finally had a chance to use these and was not impressed with how they worked. went to store and bought different ones
customer_reviews.author: Ero

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Had these stored in my truck, and had worked well for the smaller items I’ve hauled- grills, bookshelf’s, dressers, etc. I tried them out when I bought a larger motorcycle (KLR 650) and they worked wonderfully. Drove from southern Utah to northern Utah (Several mountain passes, bumpy roads) bike did not move at all. At one stop I had about one click to get the back right strap right again. Will update again if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Fronk

customer_reviews.title: incredibly flimsy
customer_reviews.text: If you're strapping down pillows in the back of your daughters barbie jeep, you should be ok. If you're expecting to tie down a motorcycle, building materials, furniture or anything else, forget it. Apparently I missed the return window, or these things would have gone back. I own a lot of ratchet straps and I tie things down in the bed of my truck or trailer on a regular basis. These are, without a doubt, the flimsiest ratchets I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: M/S A

customer_reviews.title: overhyped, you are buying branding here not quality.
customer_reviews.text: mediocre quality. Sheet metal parts in the ratchet are several gauges too thin. I can easily bend them with my fingers. Not likely to survive any sort of rough duty. Ok for light duty. The straps are a bit better quality, but the ratchet is definitely the week point. I don't expect them to last through more than a couple years of use at most and I wouldn't be surprised if the ratchet mechanism folded the first time it was banged around. Way overpriced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made could have bought similar item at LOWES but decided to help a VETmy fault I should have done due diligence ,WANTED MADE IN USA.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great straps!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I have these and their larger ones, they are both awesome! By far the best I've ever used. Recently I used these to help move some furniture. I was alone so I used them to strap the dollies to a long dresser and it worked great. The rubber on the ratchets makes them comfortable to use but the real winning feature is the clips on the hooks. Those make getting things strapped down much easier, especially when alone without someone to hold it in place. Both sets have been great and the included bag and straps complete a nice kit. Also having the Velcro keepers to keep things organized is nice too. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: VVBulldog

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I would expect from a set of tie down straps and more. Length is perfect. Easy to adjust to the right size. My favorite thing by far is the rubber over the release latch. Other straps always a pain to grab a metal release. These make it easy to undo the straps. Quality and value. I would purchase again. Used to strap down my sons scooter on a flat trailer to take up to college. Will use these going forward to strap down our fishing boat on the same trailer. The non ratchet other straps I bought didn’t hold a fraction of how good these work.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie115

customer_reviews.title: BUY RHINO STRAPS-best value-Made in America
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a similar 'looking' strap at auto parts store but when unboxed says its rated for 50!!!???? pounds. omg. these are sooo much better and look at their strength rating. nearly a ton!. and they ARE sturdy to hold an feel. the box they come in is so heavy duty I saved it for something, AND they give you a nice sturdy embroidered draw-string bag. nice, noone else does, I have straps all over unraveled. add to that its a small private AMERICAN-owned/madecompany & product and its a tremendous value for what you get. see America? we can still make quality stuff here, pay people fair, and have decent profit.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: two of them were frayed, making them uncertain for durability and strength.
customer_reviews.text: They seemed great when I looked upon arrival. However, when I took them out to use them, two of them were frayed making them uncertain for durability. I can't use these for they look like they would break with any minimal load/tightening. The two that are usable seem decent, but you can see in the thread where they may start fraying very easily. Only time will tell. The crank end are a bit longer than I normally use; about twice as long. So disappointing. I might have gotten a lemons but can't recommend these for purchase if every pack has two that are frayed; and others that look like it will take very little to fray.
customer_reviews.author: JJSoul

customer_reviews.title: Hooks and ratchet are great, but straps are very thin
customer_reviews.text: The hooks with their spring loaded retention clips are excellent! The ratchet mechanism seems to be high quality. Not flimsy and notchy like cheap ratchets. The only disappointment I had was the thickness of the straps. They're really thin. Not saying they aren't strong. They're just really thin. Not sure how much abrasion they can take without it compromising the capability of the strap. If you want a thicker, potentially more durable strap, buy Rhino's "Heavy Duty" straps option. Rhino's other products I've purchased and used have been excellent. These are too, they're just really thin straps.
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these off and on for just under 2 years. I don’t use them every day, not even every week. Maybe once every few months. So far I have bent 1 ratchet mechanism and broken 2 straps. Also 2 other ratchets appear to be coming apart? I’m not even sure what’s happening to them but every part of them seems loose They are stored in their bag, in the toolbox of my truck when not in use. Kept dry and out of sunlight. Honestly I have straps that are way older and way cheaper that held up better.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: RHINO USA headline, but made in China
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a good product, definitely heavier duty that what you'd buy at a Menards or Walmart, I'll be using it in the next several weeks so will get a better feel for use and durability. I was a little surprised about all the reference to USA, then a Made in China label. Packages do state USA designed and engineered, hopefully the outsourced materials are high quality. The spring loaded clasps look like they will keep the hooks from coming off and the handles are rubberized and comfortable. Mechanisms seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Best ratchet straps you’ll ever buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! You can tell that these are very high quality! And the company stands behind their product by allowing you to register yours online for a warranty. They also give you a carry bag for easy storage plus, you get Velcro straps to bundle each ratchet strap individually for easier access! I’ve used mine once for a long trip hauling a dining room set over 200 miles in the bed of my pickup, and they worked great!! My favorite straps I’ve used so far, and I will stick with them!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic straps!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Nissan Titan XD. They work like any other strap except they are rated for a fare amount of cargo. The material they use is high quality as well as the buckles. They cost more then some cheapo straps but well worth the cost to keep things secure in the bed of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great set of rachet straps! We used these to secure an upright piano on piano dollies, load onto a Uhaul, and secure it inside the Uhaul for moving over 300 miles away to our home. They didn't make the task of moving the piano any easier, but they sure held tight and secured that beast. These are good quality and easy to operate. They will come in very handy for many years to come. As for moving the piano...let's just say it is permanently in its place and won't be moved anytime soon, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Marie Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This review was for the wrap-straps..I had bought the 4-strap kit with the ratchets thinking these straps were included. They weren't. I could have gotten by; the hooks on the strap- end are coated - but it just seemed half-assed, so I bought these straps. They are very strong and quality made. Pics: 1- wrap-strap, strap, and ratchet. 2-wrap-strap and strap hook, 3- safety use of these wrap-straps. (Don't forget a set of ground screw anchors.
customer_reviews.author: PajamaGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Straps but Horrible Red Dye Used.
customer_reviews.text: The straps appeared to be sturdy and well made with a solid feel to the ratchet portion. Additionally I liked the long length of the straps. Unfortunately, after unboxing and placement into their storage bag, I thought my hands were covered in blood. Fortunately it was just the cheap red dye used in coloring. It covered my hands, was on my clothes and even on the table and floor. Hopefully this only an isolated issue with this set as I hope to order a replacement set, but the red ones I received were promptly returned.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Securing household goods for 1,500-mile move
customer_reviews.text: The straps come in a handy pouch which I keep in the door of my truck. We are using our Rhino straps this week to secure our belongings in a 26' trailer for a move across seven states. The ratcheting mechanism is more precise and releases easier than cheaper straps made in China. I gladly pay more for American made products that outperform their foreign competitors; the better product is cheaper in the long run and my purchases keep Americans employed.
customer_reviews.author: FEO

customer_reviews.title: AMAZINGLY sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased these to secure items to my roof rack, for which they work great. But in an emergency last weekend, we actually used these to tow our Subaru Forester out of a steep, rocky incline, on a 4x4 road. We underestimated how difficult the off-roading would be, and our friends had to tow us out with their 4runner. We didn't have any tow straps, but luckily, these worked in a pinch. These are rated for 1,823lb, but my Forester weighs about 3,500, plus a full car of camping gear, and the straps didn't snap or break. The material covering the hooks got worn down, obviously, due to the extreme load... but oh man. These are incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is the second buy from rhino. The first was a recovery strap that I like but thankfully haven't used yet. These straps are pretty good too. I haven't tried to break them or anything but the mechanism is pretty smooth and they are easy to use. Sometimes on the cheap straps after you've used them a few times the releases get to where they will kinda go cockeyed but these seem to stay square. I'll probably keep buying rhino stuff. Price is good and the products are legit. Kids stole the rhino stickers for the Barbie 4 wheeler so they dig it too.
customer_reviews.author: Biggoat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Straps are very high quality, great length, sturdy, and easy to use. Ratchets and release even let my fat fingers operate them with ease. I've moved a few couches and strapped down my kayaks and these straps do the job very, very well. The extra velcro straps for rewinding the straps back up are also a nice touch. If I ever think I need more than 4 straps, I'll be sure to get these exact same straps again! Interested in seeing what else this company makes based on the quality I saw from these straps.
customer_reviews.author: BearcatEng21

customer_reviews.title: Basic light-duty "Made in China" straps
customer_reviews.text: Nothing "USA" about these straps. They're small tie down straps with virtually identical specs to the cheapest you would get at a hardware store like Harbor Freight. Thin webbing that will tear if it even grazes a rough edge. Will be fine for moving small items, but don't trust them too much. Remove the deceptive USA branding and sell these for what they are and I could give a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Solid straps, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great straps, I used them to tie down a 680lb motorcycle for 800 miles and they held just fine. They did stretch by an inch or so but nothing a quick ratchet down wouldn't fix. I did have one of the straps break but totally my fault i had it going over a right angle piece of the bike's frame and it popped at around 600 miles. I really like the rubber coating on the ratchets.
customer_reviews.author: Jason.Robin

customer_reviews.title: Not As Pictured
customer_reviews.text: These straps are ok quality, but there are several features I was expecting based on the pictures. - The kit does not include the soft straps, just the ratchet and hook-ended straps - The hooks do not have a clasp, though they are clearly shown with spring clasps + The kit did include a nice-sized storage bag velcro bands to keep the straps neat in the bag
customer_reviews.author: Greg R

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of straps.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a set of tie downs with hooks with spring loaded clips and these fit the bill. I've used them a couple of times and they worked great. They came with a bag, soft straps and velcro straps for storage. Time will tell on durability after a few rain storms. The ratchets seem to be the thing that goes bad on all my previous straps due to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and the materials started falling apart on the first use.
customer_reviews.text: These straps work. They are not the best straps out there. The clips started falling apart on the first use and the sheathing over the hooks wore through on the first time I used them to strap mountain bikes to a rack. They are kind of poorly made, I'd suggest getting better straps from a motorcycle shop or another vendor, these aren't that great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for it's claim, after a few uses I'm having issues with 2 of the 4 rachets
customer_reviews.text: So these seemed great in the beginning. I did initially have the plastic around the hooks break on me as others have mentioned. But just using them to trap down motorcycles twice I've had the clasp not slide all the way back into place and come loose once on the road. These are probably ok for very light use but I would not trust them. The HF ones I have have done a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Quality and sturdiness 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am a return customer for Rhino USA. From there tie down straps to there bungee chords to there tie downs.... all of there products are high quality and top notch. There packaging is even an indication of the quality of there products. I used these tie down straps to secure my boat during Hurricane Dorian and was not disappointed. The boat and trailer stayed secure with no movement at all. I will continue to be a customer to Rhino USA products.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Rhino USA knows how to do things RIGHT!! Package was complete with not only the 4 straps and buckles but also a BAG and instructions that actually made complete sense!! In addition there were 4 velcro strips to secure around the straps for storage in the BAG.....did I mention the bag????? YES this is something that I LOVE about Rhino they include a bag for your item so you can keep everything together!! Highly recommend this product and anything from RHINO USA!
customer_reviews.author: KELLIE O'CONNOR

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Tie-Downs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some worn out and lost tie downs, and am happy with these. My impression is that the quality isn't really a significant improvement over the big orange home center's cheaper house brand, but I like that the purchase supports a smaller company that appears to stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Truely, I love GoRhino for a lot of reasons...small business making a big impact, family run, and great products. All of the products I have purchased from GoRhino are just legit in every way. The packaging is great, the storage bags and boxes are great, and the straps are GREAT! Keep up the good work guys!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ramey

customer_reviews.title: First impression.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the ratchet straps but did want to share my first impressions: 1) I like they came with a bag to store them in. 2) I like my tools to be neat and orderly. These straps came with Velcro wraps to keep to them held together when not in use. 3) They came with a strap with a loop on each end for all four straps to allow the straps to be used when there isn't a place for the hook. 4) While they're only a 1" strap they appear to be sturdy. I use straps like this on a daily basis. I hope they're as functional and well built as they appear to be.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Atchison

customer_reviews.title: Great for mounting solar shade sails on decks and docks too!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to control the tension in solar shade sails mounted over salt water. They are fabulous! Withstand daily 13-22 mph winds and frequent thunderstorms with 65+ mph gusts, hail and downpours. Best part... I just click the ratcheting mechanisms once or twice after a big storm to re-tighten the sails. I've only had them for a few months but so far they've held up well despite the salt, sun, moisture, and punishing winds. And best of all - I love not having to climb up a ladder to retighten my solar sails every day.
customer_reviews.author: M O

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up, sturdy straps, smooth ratchet, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If you need these one time and you’ve got them they pay for themselves. Never had this brand before but I used them several times...sturdy and easy to use. Ratchet quickly without any problems. Nylon webbing is thick and strong. Perfect for matching stuff down to a roof rack. No damage to the car either.
customer_reviews.author: brightnight

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I'm so shocked at the presentation , quality and bunch of extras in the box. U even get a badass little rhino sticker. A nice bag to put the straps in . I'm just so happy with this. Tired of receiving junk from other company's. Finally someone that stands behind their product and delivers quality. So kudos to u. I'll be using these to ratchet down my Harley fatboy to the motorcycle jack.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Well built product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and well built product. Great for strapping things down. Used to fold down a queen mattress for transit (folded in half like a taco with 3 straps). Also used to hold a stacker washer and dryer appliance down in the bed of a pickup truck. They work great for a very fair and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Lint Monster

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: These straps are long enough to get over large/tall items, they have retainers on the hooks that keep them in place until they're tightened down, and the ratcheting mechanism is solid (not like some flimsy competitors) with nice rubber grips. This is a quality investment at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdog

customer_reviews.title: Nice straps
customer_reviews.text: Using these to secure beach cargo on my hitch rack, works perfectly. A little too long for my intended purpose but easy enough to zip tie or tie away extra straps. Carrying bag is nice addition as well. Never used for super heavy duty use so can't speak for that, but perfect for securing general use gear.
customer_reviews.author: Shaco

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, they are ratchet straps--they are easy to use and get the job done, for probably only a short while. Just don't rub or touch them on anything abrasive, and I mean at all. The fabric is so incredibly flimsy, after my first use I already have fraying without even strapping things down all that hard. Should probably just buy some more expensive ones that will last. Disappointing that they are not made in America, just "designed and engineered" which I didn't realize until I received the package, but that's my bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality, strength and affordability from an American Company!  Thank you Rhino!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these along withand both are easily the best money I've spent on anything in quite a while. High quality, good price and American made. Worthwhile purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lowne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have had these straps for 6 months now. Use to tie down my ATV’s on to trailer. They have been wet, full of mud and even frozen on last hunting trip. With all the abuse, ratchet mechanism still works like new. Had to get a replacement strap due to one strap started to fray. Contacted Rhino customer service Via email and reply was same day letting me know a new one was being shipped. Had an issue with shipping which was USPS fault that required multiple conversations with Rhino. Each time was quick response. Hard to find good customer service these days and Rhino went above and beyond to take care of me. Highly recommend these straps and this company.
customer_reviews.author: Heather N Wright

customer_reviews.title: Really like
customer_reviews.text: I love the clips on the end. It makes the tie downs easy. So often when running a strap across something, it will unhook once you run the strap. This way it clicks and cannot come loose. The rubber piece that is on the clip will slide. No biggie just push it back on
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Kiel

customer_reviews.title: Good straps
customer_reviews.text: I needed these because my old straps always seem to be dwindling down every time I use my truck to move something and I need straps to hold my cargo in place. I've only used these once, but it did the job well and I really like it comes in it's on storage back. It makes keeping up with them much easier. I will admit one of the main selling points was the straps are made in the USA. I don't see that often. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Charmer

customer_reviews.title: A+ Product in every respect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of ratchet straps in the back of my truck. Besides being a retired construction guy, I'm also an RVer. These straps make all the others look bad! They are sturdy, easy to use, come in a bag and got here one day after I ordered them. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Dale Utt

customer_reviews.title: Stains everything RED!
customer_reviews.text: These straps will stain everything it touches. The straps leave red dye on everything they touch; even when they're dry. I used them for the first time (on a totally dry day) to secure 2x4s to the roof. It stained both my hands and boards red. Then we used these to tie down a christmas tree (in the rain), and red dye started dripping all over the car interior, since the straps were looped inside of the door frames. Avoid this product unless everything you own is already red. UPDATED: Excellent customer service; they sent a replacement product... unfortunately it has the same problem. I'll update this post if I hear back from Rhino.
customer_reviews.author: August G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.... quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for.. needed tie down straps for new utility trailer I purchased.. These are not the same you find at auto parts stores ... the workmanship and materials are far better and ratchets Are easy to use....highly recommend....you won’t be disappointed....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk product
customer_reviews.text: 1st one buckle broke the second time i used them. now a second buckle has broken by the 5th use (not the strap, the mechanism and spring) I thought i was buying an american solid company but think they are complete junk, i do like the extensions though
customer_reviews.author: Prof OMS

customer_reviews.title: Thinner straps than expected, but they work well for my use
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed besides how well packed these are is that the straps themselves are very thin nylon material. I have many other ratchet tie downs and none are even close to this thin. not sure if it matters as long as they hold the weight they claim to but I was expecting something more. Other than that these are great, ratchet part works very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: jeremyg

customer_reviews.title: Be carful of the Red ones!
customer_reviews.text: Dye from the red covered my hands and stained my seat to my new golf cart. Bought straps to bring golf cart home . I have used many other Rhino products no problems. Very disappointed and mad about my seat. I had to stop at Wally World and buy strap that did bleed of the color and try remove stain from seat.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine N.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked how they arrived in the box with the carry cloth bag. The weight and workmanship of these straps is excellent. We did not need to use them for why we bought them but my husband is so impressed by what he sees he’s not sending them back. They are in his truck now!
customer_reviews.author: Momobrien

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to use product and well packaged.
customer_reviews.text: Product looks good. Very easy to use/operate. I used it to secure a cooler filled with water bottles in the trunk to keep it from sliding around. I gave it 3 stars for sturdiness and durability cuz i only had it for roughly 2 weeks. Its too short to know how this will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about these straps. I did have a issue with the color bleeding on them but was contacted from the manufacture and they offered to replace them. They were very nice but I washed them and they are just fine.love the product and made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Roger Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Best Ratchet Straps I ever used
customer_reviews.text: Love these Ratchet straps. I usually fear working with any kind of ratchet strap as they usually don't work or jam. These have a sturdy release mechanism that works perfectly. Simple to loop the belt through the ratchet body and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: ejb

customer_reviews.title: Quality made in China
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being a Rhino USA product made in CHINA, this appears a well-made quality product. I would readily buy again, or recommend to others.

customer_reviews.title: Well built, phenomenal customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these straps to replace some old straps which served me well for years. These arrived promptly and appear to be well built and sturdy. I did experience an issue with one of the straps however I contacted Rhino’s customer service and they were extremely quick to address it. Due to the built quality and customer service they have earned a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: R.W.

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit might be a little more expensive than others but they’re well worth it. I ended up buying a second. The spring clips that hold the hooks in place are so nice. The bag is sturdy; the hook and loop straps are great; and the wrap around straps for awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: A Step Up In Quality
customer_reviews.text: I think I have used cheap straps for such a long time I forgot what a good strap even looks like. These straps are a step above and are worth the higher cost for sure. They have a new customer and I would purchase again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: NewZona Rides

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made Product
customer_reviews.text: Very well-made and sturdy. There have been 2 times when the webbing has loosened after being in transit. It was very tightly bound when I started. I have not had that issue with other straps. Will need to monitor my technique more closely.
customer_reviews.author: BKBLMN

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: “RhinoUSA”. MADE IN CHINA. Come on that’s just false advertising in my book. They work great don’t get me wrong but if they aren’t made in USA take that out of you title that’s just some low down dirty advertising and I won’t buy anything from you again!
customer_reviews.author: Garry Boettcher

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to use. But did not hold up like I thought.
customer_reviews.text: They did not hold up like I thought they would.I used mine for my polaris ranger one strap handle has already broken. I even put the RHINO sticker on my tailgait I will still use the other 3 straps.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Spalding

customer_reviews.title: Security and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: These straps will not secure a motorcycle. Was on our way to Bike week and with in 10 miles we had to stop and readjust the straps. Went through a major city which is another 40 miles down the road and we just about lost the bike. We had to use some older straps that we brought to secure the bike. These straps are not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: On my third use, they broke. The strap broke in half. I was using them in the back of my toyhauler, so it wasn't even exposed to elements. Would not suggest buying at all. I've had better straps purchased from a store with blue all over.
customer_reviews.author: Barney

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far they seem strong. Using them for a sun shade. I wish there was a better way to secure the excess. They come with one wrap strips, but I've seen some straps with a velcro loop attached on the ends. These strips that come with these will probably end up lost. Time will tell if they survive the AZ sun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 weeks and broken ratchet. Rust on all of them already.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 weeks ago and one ratchet completely broke at hinge. The others are completely rusted. The retaining clips are hard to get around thicket attachment points. I have had other brands of ratchets last years. This one lasted 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Trish

customer_reviews.title: These from RHINO feel more sturdy than other brands
customer_reviews.text: The Ratchet Straps are a little hard to undo. Maybe I'm not doing it quite right. They're definitely better than other 1" straps I've use in the past. Others have snapped or fallen apart on me. These from RHINO feel more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: High Quality-Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Straps appear to be of high quality. They held a pool heater in place in my truck for 150 miles. The padded handle is a big plus, I've hurt my hands on cheaper units with metal handles. I also like the fact they are made in the USA. We all need to support U.S. manufacturing whenever possible. I am very satisfied and would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: flt996

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use
customer_reviews.text: First use of these straps they failed. Hauled a CanAm Defender side-by-side (weighs 1900lbs) 2 hours to where I fish. By the time I got there, one of the ratchets failed, and the stitching on 2 of the other hooks ripped. I was surprised because they advertise these as being heavy duty. I’m lucky The side-by-side didn’t come off the trailer. Very disappointed in these. I resorted to my old pair to hold it down, which have a lower strength, and they did much better. I would not recommend, look elsewhere if you care about the cargo you’re hauling, and the people driving behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Great customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Just as advertised. I was missing the augmentation strap. I called Rhino customer support. Told them. They were happy to help me. Mailed the straps "3 Day Priority Mail". Amazing. Awesome customer support. Thanks Guys.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Wassmuth

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and really poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I simply can't believe how this is even sold. Its less than 1 mm thick! Compare that with a seat belt that has to handle way less load than 800 kg (that would crash a human). I would not trust my bike or anything to this product. Going back now. The hooks are a joke
customer_reviews.author: rc

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't tie my most important gear down with anything else!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these straps to tie down two kayaks on my roof rack. The straps that came with the roof rack system were probably adequate for short trips around town, but not long highway journeys. These straps are as solid as they come and they include an awesome carrying case and velcro loops to keep things secure and organized between uses. Highly recommend springing for these straps if you're in need.
customer_reviews.author: Evan F.

customer_reviews.title: A must for moving
customer_reviews.text: These chords saved our furniture from shifting/moving. We didn't do the best job packing but these did an excellent job holding everything in place. It's the best investment in moving supplies that you could spend on. I highly recommend them. And you can still use them after you've moved.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: This Strap set is GREAT! They thought of everything.
customer_reviews.text: Rhino USA knows how to make quality products. These strong, easy to use straps are GREAT! They even included some quality velcro-like straps to keep the straps wrangled when they're not being used. An AWESOME purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GARY W HICKS

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The rubber coating on these started ripping off after one use (and note my bike weighs 350 pounds with a full tank). These straps look nice, but obviously their durability is just not there. Would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, but...
customer_reviews.text: These are great straps and the best I have purchased so far. But only time will really tell. So far it seems as if there's some wear and tear from basic use. The wear and tear isn't significant by any means, but it's somewhat noticeable. But who can complain when you have a lifetime warranty! ^_^
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Trif

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The tie down straps are nice and look and feel like a quality product. I used them to tie down ATVs and motorcycles. They come in a bag to keep in them which is nice and comes in handy when you need to carry all 4 of them around.
customer_reviews.author: G. R.

customer_reviews.title: Good medium duty straps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some straps that I have had for a long time. These don’t have the same thickness of strap that I had, so I don’t use them in the heavy items I strap in the truck. But for the medium weight stuff, they have performed admirably. I like the length, and they have not let me down yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Rhino ratchet tie down straps for professional a professional moving company to use for packing furniture in. 26’ truck that was filled. The movers were extremely happy with the Rhino ratchet tie down straps. I drove the 26’ truck filled with furniture 500 miles and everything in the truck was exactly where it was supposed to be. The Rhino ratchet tie down straps Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: J. Fenley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tool to secure and move a refrigerator with no difficulty. The straps work as advertised and are extremely well made. The company is very interested in ensuring that the product meets a high standard of quality.
customer_reviews.author: bill t.

customer_reviews.title: Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for Christmas presents. The look as if the are very good quality. My husband and son were shocked that they came with lifetime guarantee. They seem to have trouble with the ones they purchase from other manufacturers breaking all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisi

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: Used these to tie down my kayaks on my SUV. Very solid construction. Come in a carrying bag which is a nice touch. Not sure how long the rubber coating on the hooks will last - so I'll just keep an eye on that. Otherwise, I recommend these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: USA STRONG! Thanks RHINO!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than others I have bought and used. These feel strong and well manufactured. The first and second uses proved that to be the case, so I am very pleased with this product and if the time comes when I need, or a friend needs some, I will buy or recommend these highly. A great item and a nice price! The best? Made In The USA!
customer_reviews.author: Willie D

customer_reviews.title: handles are so weak
customer_reviews.text: The strap and hook portions are of good quality. The first use I wasn't even getting the ratchet tight and the handle wrinkled up like it was made of aluminum foil. I don't think I will trust them on anything major from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ratchet Straps!
customer_reviews.text: Great tie-down! I bought these a few months as my number of functioning straps dwindled, and these were a great upgrade and replacement for the ones I was using. These are much nicer, thicker webbing and heavier material in the ratchet than my others. I will definitely be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Worley

product_meta.title: RHINO USA Ratchet Straps (4PK) - 1,823lb Guaranteed Max Break Strength, Includes (4) Premium 1in x 15ft Rachet Tie Downs with Padded Handles. Best for Moving, Securing Cargo (BLACK)
feature_bullets: ▶ SUPPORT A SMALL FAMILY CO. - Buy From a Father/Son Business in California & Receive a Lifetime Warranty!
▶ SUPERIOR QUALITY MATERIALS - Anodized Ratchet, Ergonomic Padded Handle & Coated Full Bend S Hooks
▶ CONFIDENCE & PEACE OF MIND - Knowing your Motorcycle, ATV, UTV or Cargo is Secure when Transporting!
▶ STRONGEST RATCHETS ONLINE - Our Exclusive Poly/Silk Webbing is the Strongest 1" Ratchet on Amazon
▶ GUARANTEED 5-STAR EXPERIENCE - If you aren't 100% Satisfied for any Reason, well Refund your Money

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,480 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
